page.title: 18THE MAYOR OF TAMESIDE
page.content: The Office of The Mayor of Tameside was created in 1975 with the re-organisation of the local councils. Mossley, having been a Borough for 90 years, already had a tradition of local mayors but Geoff Brierley was the first Mossley-born Mayor of Tameside. James Geoffrey Brierley was born on the 27th August 1928 and at the age of sixteen became a member of the Labour Party. He worked for 26 years as the Grocery manager at the Mossley Co-op and left there when the branch was closed taking up his present occupation as a postman. All his 57 years have been lived in Mossley and for 12 of these has served as a councillor firstly on Mossley Council and at present Tameside M.B.C.
